programme.desc: A woman who had her first nose job at the age of 12 undergoes rhinoplasty; at the same time, Dr. Dubrow helps a patient who wants to retire her enormous breasts; and the docs are left speechless by a very unique individual.

programme.title: Botched
programme.desc: Terry makes a breast cancer survivor feel whole again; and receives a visit from his favorite patient when his wife Heather shows up for a chitchat. Meanwhile, Paul works his magic on two sisters' twin beaks.

programme.title: Botched
programme.desc: A woman who feels totally unlucky receives a boost from the doctors; a patient who previously was rejected by the docs returns with a problem bigger than her breasts; and a transgender showgirl wants to become her favorite cartoon character.

programme.title: Botched
programme.desc: Dr. Dubrow operates on a transgender woman's uniboob; Dr. Nassif fixes a 24-year-old crater on a woman's nose; and the docs meet a potential patient who aspires to be a plastic doll.

programme.title: Botched
programme.desc: In the Season 2 finale, Dr. Dubrow keeps it all in the family when he performs full-body work on a pair of codependent sisters. Meanwhile, Dr. Nassif operates on a large man with an even larger nose; and the doctors meet a corset-wearing YouTube star.

programme.title: Daily Pop
programme.desc: Kandi Burruss of \"Real Housewives of Atlanta\" makes an appearance.

programme.title: Overserved With Lisa Vanderpump

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kim and Kourtney force Khloe to take a sentimental sister trip to Palm Springs to relive some of their fondest childhood memories from a much simpler time. programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Rob struggles to find a way to be civil with Chyna for the sake of their daughter; Khloe puts Kourtney through a series of silly tests in hopes of curing her indecisiveness; and Kim jets to New York with Kylie for Kanye's Yeezy fashion show.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Kim is torn over maintaining a relationship with Cait and decides to first confirm that her mom's reason for cutting ties is valid. programme.title: Keeping Up With the Kardashians
programme.desc: Khloé explores the possibility of becoming Kim's surrogate, but receives some shocking news about her own fertility in the process. Meanwhile, the sisters pressure Kourtney to step her flirting game up; and Rob threatens to bail on his 30th birthday.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil's preoccupation with a business opportunity blinds him to his new partner's inappropriate behavior around Claire. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria may regret letting Mitchell and Cameron be their temporary house guests when their home is being fumigated.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire go overboard with drinks—and divulging personal information—on a night out to celebrate the sale of a house to Mitchell and Cameron's friends.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Gloria learns about a secret that Claire has been hiding; one of Jay's proudest golf moments is ruined by Mitchell; Phil makes an inadvertent—and uncomfortable—discovery about one of his daughters.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The pressure is on Mitchell to get Cameron's birthday celebration just right, since he was born on Leap Day and it only comes once every four years. Meanwhile, Jay undergoes a masculinity crisis; and Phil's Leap Day plans hit a snag.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron has a reunion with his estranged clown partner at a funeral for their former mentor; Phil gets bullied by a real-estate rival when he tries to land an important listing; Jay and Gloria are leery of Manny's new friend.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire's race for town council comes to a head on Election Day as the Dunphys make phone calls for votes and Mitchell and Cameron take to the streets to campaign, while the candidate endures technical problems during some last-minute interviews.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A visit from Cameron's father features an awkward dinner for Jay and Gloria at Mitchell and Cameron's house. Meanwhile, Claire helps Luke face the death of an older neighbor; Phil and Alex have a father-daughter bonding experience; and Haley throws a party without permission.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil goes car shopping with his neighbor Andre, but in the end will probably wish he'd taken Claire instead. Meanwhile, Jay sets off for his high-school reunion with Gloria and Manny; and Lily's favorite stuffed animal is lost on a commuter train.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The entire Pritchett clan go to Disneyland, where Phil has trouble keeping up with Luke; Claire is surprised by an encounter with Dylan; Jay and Gloria debate suitable footwear; and Mitchell and Cameron cope with Lily's recent inclination to run anywhere at anytime.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Alex's school project on family harmony is in jeopardy when it seems no one can get along, which is exemplified by Jay and Gloria's spat over lunch and Manny getting upset by Luke accepting an award he may not deserve. programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Georgia Tech at Georgia. The Bulldogs edged Tech 18-17 on Kanon Parkman's 34-yard FG with 47 seconds left.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1983: Auburn vs. Alabama in Birmingham. Auburn edged the Tide, 23-20.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1986: Auburn vs. Alabama in Birmingham. The Tigers knocked off their state rivals 21-17 in the annual Iron Bowl.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2003: Alabama at Auburn. Known as the \"Go Crazy, Cadillac\" game, Auburn outgained the Tide 519-291 as Cadillac Williams opened and closed the scoring with TDs. It was the second win in a six-game Iron Bowl streak for the Tigers.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1997: Alabama at Auburn. The Tigers edged their state rival 18-17.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Alabama at Auburn. The Tigers downed their cross-state rival 31-27.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2011: Ohio State at Michigan. The Wolverines beat OSU 40-34. Denard Robinson racked up 337 yards of total offense and scored 5 TDs (three passing, two rushing).

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1999: Ohio State at Michigan. The Wolverines won 24-17.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1999: Mississippi at Mississippi State in the 96th Egg Bowl game. The Bulldogs edged Ole Miss 23-20 to claim state bragging rights for the second straight year.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1997: Mississippi at Mississippi State in the 94th edition of the \"Battle for the Golden Egg.\" The Rebels edged State 15-14.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2010: Mississippi State at Mississippi. MSU beat the Rebels 31-23, with Chris Relf tossing 3 TD passes.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1991: Florida State at Florida. The Gators edged their intrastate rivals, downing FSU 14-9 in Gainesville.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1989: Florida State at Florida. The 'Noles downed their bitter rival 24-17 in Gainesville.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Florida State at Florida. The third-ranked Gators downed their state rival 35-24 in Gainesville.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1995: Florida State vs. Florida in the Sugar Bowl in New Orleans. The Seminoles downed Florida 23-17 despite Danny Wuerffel's record 394 yards passing.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1993: Florida State at Florida. The Seminoles outscored Florida 33-21. Charlie Ward threw for 446 yards, including a 79-yard TD pass to Warrick Dunn with 5:28 to play.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2004: Florida at Florida State. The Gators won 20-13 giving Ron Zook his first win on 'Noles turf. Chris Leak threw for 231 yards and a touchdown.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2006: Florida at Florida State. The Gators beat FSU 21-14, with Chris Leak tossing 2 TD passes.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 1996: Florida at Florida State. The Seminoles upset top-ranked Florida 24-21 in Tallahassee.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2007: Los Angeles Lakers at Cleveland Cavaliers
programme.desc: From 2007: Los Angeles Lakers at Cleveland. The Cavs won 94-90, with LeBron James scoring 33 points.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2006: Los Angeles Lakers at Cleveland Cavaliers
programme.desc: From 2006: Los Angeles Lakers at Cleveland. The Cavs won 96-95 despite 38 points from Kobe Bryant, who missed a buzzer-beating three-pointer.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2006: Cleveland Cavaliers at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: From 2006: Cleveland at Los Angeles Lakers. L.A. won 99-98 after LeBron James missed a free throw with five seconds left.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2005: Cleveland Cavaliers at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: From 2005: Cleveland at Los Angeles Lakers. Lamar Odom scored 24 points as the Lakers won 98-94.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: A look at the 1960 tournament. Arnold Palmer edged Ken Venturi by one stroke to earn the second of his four green jackets.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1978 event at Augusta National. Gary Player earned a one-stroke victory over Rod Funseth, Hubert Green and Tom Watson for his third green jacket.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Arnold Palmer's 1962 victory at Augusta National. Palmer defeated Gary Player and Dow Finsterwald in an 18-hole playoff.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Jack Nicklaus's 1963 victory at Augusta. Nicklaus won his first green jacket by one stroke over Tony Lema.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Arnold Palmer's 1964 victory. Palmer won his fourth green jacket by six strokes over Dave Marr and Jack Nicklaus.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Jack Nicklaus's 1965 victory at Augusta National. Nicklaus won his second green jacket by nine strokes over Arnold Palmer and Gary Player.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Jack Nicklaus's 1966 victory at Augusta, his second consecutive green jacket and third overall.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Gay Brewer's 1967 victory at Augusta National. Brewer defeated Bobby Nichols by one stroke.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Billy Casper's 1970 win at Augusta National. Casper captured a four-stroke victory over Gene Littler.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Charles Coody's 1971 win. Coody won by two strokes over Jack Nicklaus and Johnny Miller for his only major championship.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1972 tournament at Augusta National. Jack Nicklaus won his fourth green jacket by three strokes over Bruce Crampton, Bobby Mitchell and Tom Weiskopf.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: A review of the 1973 tournament at Augusta National. Tommy Aaron defeated J.C. Snead by one stroke.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1974 event at Augusta National. Gary Player beat Tom Weiskopf and Dave Stockton by two strokes for his second green jacket.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1975 event at Augusta National. Jack Nicklaus won his fifth green jacket by one stroke over Johnny Miller and Tom Weiskopf.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1977 tournament at Augusta National. Tom Watson won by two strokes over Jack Nicklaus to earn his first green jacket.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1978 event at Augusta National. Gary Player earned a one-stroke victory over Rod Funseth, Hubert Green and Tom Watson for his third green jacket.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1979 tournament at Augusta National. Fuzzy Zoeller defeated Ed Sneed and Tom Watson in a sudden-death playoff.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1980 tournament at Augusta National. Seve Ballesteros won by four strokes over Rod Runseth, Hubert Green and Tom Watson.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1981 tournament at Augusta National. Tom Watson won his second green jacket by two strokes over Johnny Miller and Jack Nicklaus.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1983 tournament at Augusta National. Seve Ballesteros defeated Ben Crenshaw and Tom Kite by four strokes for his second green jacket.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Ben Crenshaw's 1984 win. Crenshaw won his first green jacket by two strokes over Tom Watson.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Bernhard Langer's 1985 victory at Augusta National. Langer won his first green jacket by two strokes over Seve Ballesteros, Ray Floyd and Curtis Strange.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1986 event at Augusta National. Jack Nicklaus won his sixth green jacket at age 46 by one stroke over Tom Kite and Greg Norman.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Larry Mize's 1987 victory at Augusta National. Mize holed a chip shot to beat Seve Ballesteros and Greg Norman in a playoff.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1988 tournament at Augusta National. Sandy Lyle won the event by one stroke over Mark Calcavecchia.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1989 tournament, won by Nick Faldo in a playoff with Scott Hoch.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Nick Faldo's 1990 victory at Augusta National. Faldo beat Ray Floyd in a playoff to claim his second consecutive green jacket.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Ian Woosnam's 1991 victory at Augusta National. Woosnam defeated Jose Maria Olazabal by one stroke.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Fred Couples' 1992 win at Augusta National. Couples captured his first major championship, defeating 1976 champ Raymond Floyd by two strokes.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: Bernhard Langer's 1993 win. It was his second green jacket.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1994 tournament at Augusta National. Jose Maria Olazabal won his first Masters title by two strokes over Tom Lehman.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1995 tournament at Augusta National. Ben Crenshaw won his second green jacket by one stroke over Davis Love III.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: The 1996 tournament at Augusta National. Nick Faldo won his third green jacket by five strokes over Greg Norman, who held a six-stroke lead on Sunday.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: A review of Tiger Woods' record-setting performance in the 1997 tournament. Woods shot an 18-under 270 and rolled to a 12-shot victory to become the youngest Masters winner ever.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: A review of the 1998 tournament in Augusta, Ga. Mark O'Meara won his first major with a birdie on the 72nd hole.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: A recap of the 1999 tournament. Spaniard Jose Maria Olazabal won his second green jacket, defeating Davis Love III by two strokes.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: A recap of the 2000 tournament. Fijian Vijay Singh captured the green jacket with a three-stroke victory over Ernie Els.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: A review of the 2001 event in Augusta. Tiger Woods won his second green jacket with a 16-under par 272, two shots better than David Duval.

programme.title: Masters Highlights (?)
programme.desc: A recap of the 2002 tournament in Augusta. Tiger Woods claimed his third green jacket and second straight win here with a three-shot victory over Retief Goosen.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia.

Clemente: John Leguizamo.

Clemente: John Leguizamo.

programme.title: ER

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Abby and Kovac agonize over what to do about her pregnancy, while Neela counsels an expectant teenager. Meanwhile, Clemente gets a visit from the police as they investigate a past incident; and Weaver takes a nasty spill on the ice.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Left in charge of the ER, an overwhelmed Dr. Dubenko oversees the case of a terminally ill elderly woman whose devoted husband wants to keep her alive. Meanwhile, Ray intervenes when Zoe is beaten by her father; and Gallant has a stunning announcement for Neela.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Abby has a hard time dealing with the fact that her former medical-school professor and mentor (James Woods) is suffering from Lou Gehrig's disease and has come to the ER with a serious bout of pneumonia. Fran: Ally Walker.

programme.title: ER

programme.title: House

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Cuddy's mother (Candice Bergen) considers filing a malpractice suit against the hospital, which could put her daughter's and House's medical licenses in jeopardy. Meanwhile, luck runs out for a lottery winner (Donal Logue).

programme.title: House
programme.desc: House attempts to resuscitate the career of a washed-up boxer (Kevin Phillips) following a disputed wager with Wilson. Meanwhile, the team suspects that House might have another kind of drug problem.

programme.title: House

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Season 7 finale: A hospitalized performance artist (Shohreh Aghdashloo) might have made herself sick---to make a film about her illness. Meanwhile, House does something odd (even for him), which could alter his relationships with Wilson and Cuddy for good.

programme.title: House
programme.desc: Season 8 opens a year after House drove his car into Cuddy's house, and he's in jail—trying to diagnose an ill fellow inmate without breaking prison rules, an effort that complicates life for clinic physician Jessica Adams (Odette Annable). programme.title: House

programme.desc: Penny starts a hair-product business that suffers when her friends, particularly Sheldon, become involved.

programme.title: Full Frontal With Samantha Bee
programme.desc: Full Frontal explores the recent trend of white women flocking to QAnon while Mike Brown meets a group of barbers who are working hard to get Black Americans vaccinated against COVID. Plus, Aly & AJ perform.

programme.title: The Egg and I
programme.desc: Funny adaptation of Betty MacDonald's book about city folk down on the farm.

programme.title: The Enchanted Cottage
programme.desc: A scarred World War II veteran and a plain young woman discover true love, beauty and a magical transformation for both after moving into a small house on a sprawling estate. A remake of a 1924 silent melodrama based on a play by Arthur Wing Pinero.

programme.title: Charade
programme.desc: A woman in Paris flees murderous crooks who seek a hidden World War II fortune stolen by her late husband, and receives unlikely assistance from a handsome sophisticate with a hidden agenda.

programme.title: The Entertainer
programme.desc: A waning British music hall performer who lives with his second wife, retired entertainer father and faithful son, struggles to stay relevant. Facing financial troubles and armed with only his tired act, he gets his father to come out of retirement in an attempt to find success. Based on the play by John Osborne.

programme.title: Eskimo
programme.desc: Anthropological docudrama about an Alaskan hunter (Mala), filmed in the Arctic by W.S. Van Dyke (who plays the Inspector).

programme.title: Executive Suite
programme.desc: When the hard-charging president of the third-largest furniture maker in the U.S. dies suddenly at the end of a business week, it sets off a scramble among the surviving vice presidents to see which of them will succeed him.

programme.title: Experiment Perilous
programme.desc: A doctor tries to save a woman from the machinations of her psychotic husband.

programme.title: The Facts of Life
programme.desc: Married middle-aged suburbanites fall in love and debate taking the extramarital plunge.

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: A boy lies to protect his idol, a butler who is suspected of murder after his shrewish wife dies.

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: Director John Schlesinger directs this version of the Thomas Hardy novel about a headstrong farm owner who must chose between her extremely different suitors.

programme.title: A Farewell to Arms
programme.desc: A WWI lieutenant falls for a nurse, but their affair is derailed by a jealous major when he has her transferred. The two rekindle their romance when the officer is wounded and lands in her hospital.

programme.title: Father of the Bride
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee is a comedy of manners concerning a harried middle-class lawyer who frets over the work, expense and frenzy surrounding the engagement and wedding of his precious daughter. Spencer Tracy, in the title role, was nominated for Best Actor. The film spawned the 1951 sequel, \"Father's Little Dividend,\" and was remade in 1991 with Steve Martin as the Dad.

programme.title: Five Easy Pieces
programme.desc: A classical pianist, who has left his upper-crust life to knock around on the road, returns home to see his ailing father and uptight family, with a pregnant girlfriend in tow.

programme.title: The 5,000 Fingers of Dr. T.
programme.desc: A youngster with a dislike for his mean-spirited piano teacher dreams he's trapped in the kingdom of the fearsome Dr. T, who has enslaved hundreds of little boys and forced them to practice on the world's largest piano until they drop. Ted Geisel, a.k.a. Dr. Seuss, cowrote this eccentric fantasy.

programme.title: Flower Drum Song
programme.desc: Rodgers and Hammerstein's stage hit about cultural problems in San Francisco's Chinatown. Nancy Kwan, James Shigeta, Miyoshi Umeki, Juanita Hall, Jack Soo. Directed by Henry Koster.

programme.title: Flying Down to Rio
programme.desc: A Brazilian woman is wooed by an American bandleader, even though she is engaged to marry his best friend.

programme.title: For Me and My Gal
programme.desc: A vaudeville team with a song-and-dance act are tested by one constantly using the other to get ahead, before they are both put to the real test by the arrival of World War I.

programme.title: Forbidden Planet
programme.desc: Shakespeare's \"The Tempest\" is translated into outer space and updated to the 23rd century, where a rocket ship lands on a faraway planet to investigate the disappearance of settlers on an alien world. The crew discovers a scientist, his daughter and a highly intelligent robot named Robby.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: A tale of murder and intrigue set on the eve of World War II, in which a New York crime reporter is sent to London to cover political machinations overseas. While there, he makes some interesting contacts, including the head of a pacifist organization and a Dutch diplomat who is privy to secret information about an Allied treaty.

programme.title: The Fortune Cookie
programme.desc: An unscrupulous lawyer tries to win a hefty verdict after a cameraman is injured while filming a football game when a player runs into him. The attorney has his client exaggerate his injuries, which leads to the guilty-feeling football player waiting hand and foot on the client.

programme.title: 42nd Street
programme.desc: This musical comedy follows the last-minute challenges that ensue for a Broadway director on the opening night of his production after his leading lady twists her ankle the evening before the premiere.

programme.title: Four Days in November
programme.desc: The assassination of President John F. Kennedy and its aftermath are recounted in depth via newsreels, amateur footage and re-created sequences. Includes the Kennedy funeral and the shooting of assassin Lee Harvey Oswald.

programme.title: The Four Feathers
programme.desc: A British army officer resigns his wartime commission, and as a result his three comrades and fiancée present him with four white feathers, symbolic of cowardice, so the disgraced man sets out alone to prove his courage during the Sudan uprising.

programme.title: The 400 Blows
programme.desc: A landmark French New Wave film about a misunderstood 12 year old boy, who without attention or direction, drifts into a life of delinquency and petty crime, completing a sad, self-fulfilling prophecy.

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: A romantic comedy chronicling multiple encounters between a shy British gentleman and an uninhibited American woman, who have their first brief meeting at a wedding and then continue to run into each other at subsequent sets of nuptials and one funeral.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: Best Picture winner is a portrait of life on a Honolulu Army post just before the attack on Pearl Harbor, and focuses on two rebellious privates and a tough but fair-minded sergeant who's swept into a torrid affair with his CO's wife.

programme.title: Funny Girl
programme.desc: Barbra Streisand won an Oscar for her portrayal of legendary stage comedian Fanny Brice as she breaks into show business, rises to stardom with the Ziegfeld Follies and finds heartache in her marriage to big-time gambler Nicky Arnstein, who at first finds it amusing to be referred to as \"Mr. Brice,\" but then begins to resent his wife's fame and fortune. Streisand actually shared the Best Actress Oscar that year with \"The Lion in Winter\" star Katharine Hepburn.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: A man wrongfully accused of kidnapping is jailed and, while awaiting trial, comes face-to-face with a mob bent on its own brand of justice. The film was Fritz Lang's first American production.

programme.title: Gandhi
programme.desc: Recalling the life of Indian lawyer Mohandas K. Gandhi (1869-1948), who famously led nonviolent revolts against British rule and spoke out against the caste system. A Best Picture winner, and Ben Kingsley won a Best Actor Oscar as the title character.

programme.title: Gaslight
programme.desc: A newlywed is slowly driven to the brink of madness by her deceptively charming husband at their Victorian mansion in London. Ingrid Bergman won Best Actress as the wife, while Charles Boyer received a Best Actor nod as her spouse and Angela Lansbury, in her film debut (at age 18), was nominated for Best Supporting Actress for her role as a sassy cockney servant.

programme.title: Giant
programme.desc: Best Picture based on the Edna Ferber bestseller about Texas cattlemen, oil, troubled romances and racial injustice chronicles the lives of one proud family from the 1930s to the '50s. James Dean's final film; George Stevens won a Best Director Oscar.

programme.title: Gigi
programme.desc: Musical adaptation of Colette's story about a girl in Paris at the turn of the century. Winner of nine Academy Awards, including Best Picture, Best Direction and Best Song ('Gigi'). Memorable tunes include 'I Remember It Well,' 'Thank Heaven for Little Girls,' 'Waltz at Maxim's.'.

programme.title: The Goodbye Girl
programme.desc: Oscar-nominated Best Picture about a divorcée (Best Actress nominee Marsha Mason) with a young daughter, and an arrogant aspiring actor (Oscar winner Richard Dreyfuss) who sublets her apartment from her former boyfriend, unbeknownst to her. Neil Simon's screenplay was also Oscar-nominated, as was supporting actress Quinn Cummings as Mason's little girl. Patricia Heaton and Jeff Daniels starred in a 2004 cable remake.

programme.title: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
programme.desc: Best Actor Robert Donat stars as the title character, a beloved schoolmaster at a British boarding school, who initially starts out as a reticent sourpuss, but over the course of 63 years of teaching evolves into a venerable academic institution. Told in flashback, the Best Picture nominee is adapted from the James Hilton best seller. The film debut of Greer Garson (Best Actress nominee), who plays Mr. Chips' engaging young bride.

programme.title: Grand Hotel
programme.desc: This Best Picture winner charts 24 hours in the lives of guests at a plush Berlin hostelry, where a down-on-his-luck thief covets a ballerina's pearls, while lusting after the mistress of a businessman whose dying bookkeeper is tended by a drunken doctor.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: Kody finally returns to Janelle's house, but the larger family conflict over COVID-19 rules continues to grow. Then, it's Kody and Meri's 30th anniversary, and Kody shows no interest in rekindling a romance, despite Meri's intense interest.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers

programme.title: Impractical Jokers

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Q, Sal, Joe, and Murr play a game of tag at a coffee shop and then convince shoppers to deliver sketchy messages at the grocery store. Tonight's big loser might lose his mind in the first-ever non-punishment punishment.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Q, Sal, Murr and Joe get their checks bounced by customers who notice unusual charges, then help out coworkers with some peculiar trust exercises. Later, the big loser finds himself balls-deep at a carnival game that's rigged for him to lose.

programme.title: American Reunion
programme.desc: Jim (Jason Biggs), Michelle and the rest of the gang return to East Great Falls for their 10-year high-school reunion in this poignant comedy. Meanwhile, Finch still looks back with lust at that perfect night he spent with Stiffler's mom.

programme.title: The Bourne Legacy
programme.desc: In this non-stop thrill ride, a scientifically engineered CIA agent goes on the run when his program is compromised, and everyone involved is ordered eliminated. Along the way, he is joined by the brilliant research scientist who helped to create him.

programme.title: The Campaign
programme.desc: In this hilarious comedy, two powerful CEOs attempt to turn a tourism-center director into a viable political candidate in order to defeat the blundering congressman of a crucial North Carolina district.

programme.title: American Woman (?)
programme.desc: Set in small-town Pennsylvania, a foxy grandmother in her early thirties struggles to make ends meet with her job as a supermarket cashier. She tries to provide for her 16-year-old daughter who's a single mom. Once her daughter disappears after a night out, the narrative spans the next 11 years as she raises her grandson, attempting to find real love and seeking answers for the mystery which may come at last.

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: In this fascinating drama, a woman suffering from chronic pain starts seeing hallucinations of a young wife who committed suicide. Later, she gets to know the latter's husband and faces her own inner demons.

programme.title: Sound of My Voice
programme.desc: Novice filmmakers go through a rigorous training program in order to infiltrate and document a cult, and confront its mysterious leader, who claims to be on a mission from the future.

programme.title: John Q
programme.desc: Riveting thriller about a family man whose son needs a lifesaving heart-transplant operation. When his health-care plan doesn't cover the boy's medical procedure, he takes drastic steps to rectify the situation.

programme.title: Season of the Witch
programme.desc: In this hair-raising supernatural thriller, medieval crusader Behmen (Nicolas Cage) and his men are ordered to capture a suspected witch and bring her back to an abbey after church officials accuse her of bringing about the Black Plague.

programme.title: The Man in the Iron Mask (?)
programme.desc: In 17th-century France, the four musketeers devise a plan to replace the widely hated King Louis XIV with a twin brother who has been imprisoned for the past six years with an iron mask on his face.

programme.title: Birth of the Dragon
programme.desc: In 1964 San Francisco, a pre-fame Bruce Lee challenges a Shaolin monk named Wong Jack Man to a fight behind closed doors. This engaging drama depicts this real-life event, which helped cement Lee's reputation as a legendary martial artist.

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon give award-winning performances and do their own singing in this touching portrait of music legend Johnny Cash and his tumultuous love affair with June Carter. Ginnifer Goodwin, Robert Patrick, Dallas Roberts. Directed by James Mangold.

programme.title: The Way Back
programme.desc: An alcoholic who has endured family tragedy works to redeem himself by coaching his high school alma mater's basketball team. But as he's brought back to his glory days as a promising athlete, he's forced to confront the demons that derailed him earlier in life.

programme.title: Hitman (?)
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin known as Agent 47 finds himself on the run with a hooker after he is double-crossed on a mission in Russia. Timothy Olyphant and Dougray Scott star in the explosive unrated adaptation of the popular video game. Olga Kurylenko, Robert Knepper, Ulrich Thomsen. Directed by Xavier Gens.

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: Exciting car chases and frenetic martial-arts action fortify this action-packed crime thriller from writer-producer Luc Besson. Jason Statham stars as Frank Martin, a deliveryman of illicit packages who gets mixed up in an Asian slave ring. Shu Qi, Matt Schulze, Ric Young, Francois Berleand.

programme.title: A Walk Among the Tombstones
programme.desc: The thrills never stop when a NYC heroin trafficker hires a haunted ex-cop to find the men who abducted and killed his wife. But as the sleuth gets closer to his targets, he realizes that they're much more sinister than he could have imagined.

programme.title: The Cell 2
programme.desc: A psychic investigator attempts to stop a sadistic serial killer who repeatedly brings his helpless victims back to life over and over again until they beg to die. Tessie Santiago stars in this terrifying sequel to the 2000 cult horror movie. Chris Bruno, Frank Whaley, Bart Johnson. Directed by Tim Iacofano.

programme.title: The Watcher
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves and James Spader star in this haunting thriller about a serial killer. Troubled FBI agent Joel Campbell (Spader) goes up against a sadistic murderer (Reeves) who sends him photos of his next victims, giving him 24 hours to save them. Marisa Tomei, Ernie Hudson, Chris Ellis, Robert Cicchini, Yvonne Niami.

programme.title: Bless the Child
programme.desc: A spiritual war is at the core of this thriller starring Kim Basinger and Jimmy Smits. Nurse Maggie O'Connor (Basinger) joins forces with FBI agent John Travis (Smits) to wage a battle against a shady satanic cult headed by the fiendish Eric Stark (Rufus Sewell), who plans to use O'Connor's gifted 6-year-old niece to further the group's evil cause. Holliston Coleman, Christina Ricci.

programme.title: Stigmata
programme.desc: Patricia Arquette leaves her mark in a bloody, creepy chiller about a \"self-confessed atheist\" who \"exhibits the wounds of Christ.\" Gabriel Byrne is riveting as a Vatican priest, a debunker of miracles, sent to investigate the religious phenomenon. He arrives and in due course witnesses a couple of terrifying incidents that rock his faith.

programme.title: Bounce
programme.desc: Ben Affleck and Gwyneth Paltrow costar in this unusual drama. Affleck plays Buddy, an exec who gives another man his plane ticket as a favor. Minutes after takeoff, the plane crashes. Feeling responsible, Buddy tries to help the man's widow (Paltrow) by entering into a business relationship with her.

programme.title: Bigger Than the Sky
programme.desc: Marcus Thomas, Amy Smart and John Corbett star in this charming romantic comedy. Thomas plays a sad sack whose life improves when he lands the lead in a community theater production of \"Cyrano de Bergerac,\" then falls for his leading lady. Sean Astin, Clare Higgins. Al Corley directed.

programme.title: Dinner for Schmucks
programme.desc: In this riotous comedy, Tim wants to snag a big promotion at work, but to do so he must take an eccentric nutcase to his boss's dinner party, where guests are supposed to bring the strangest person they can find.

programme.title: The Grifters
programme.desc: A trio of con artists become tangled in a dangerous power struggle when Roy Dillon's mother and girlfriend compete for his affection.

programme.title: Magnolia
programme.desc: In this audacious ensemble drama about the intersecting lives of troubled Californians, a dying mogul tries to reunite with his motivational-speaker son, a young quiz-show winner deals with his father's abuse and a drug addict falls for a lonely cop.

programme.title: Winter's Bone
programme.desc: In this tense rural drama, Ozarks teen Ree Dolly (Jennifer Lawrence) risks her life to find her criminal father after he puts up the family home to cover his bail and then vanishes. If Ree fails to locate her father, her family will be homeless. But tracking him down will require Ree to break her community's unofficial code of silence, which some of her family members see as unforgivable.

programme.title: Harriet
programme.desc: The incredible true story of one of America's greatest heroes, Harriet Tubman. From her escape from slavery to the dangerous missions she led, setting free hundreds of slaves through the Underground Railroad.

programme.title: Talk to Me
programme.desc: Don Cheadle's electrifying portrayal of ex-con Petey Greene, who became an influential, controversial disc jockey in 1960s Washington, D.C., as well as a beloved community activist, cues this charged, fact-based biopic. Cheadle perfectly captures Greene's tell-it-like-it-is bluntness and candor. Chiwetel Ejiofor, Taraji P. Henson, Martin Sheen, Mike Epps. Directed by Kasi Lemmons. Features an excellent period soundtrack that includes James Brown, the Dramatics and Otis Redding.

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: When their mobster husbands are sent to prison by the FBI, three New York housewives decide to continue their husbands' business on their own, soon becoming the most powerful mobsters in 1970s Hell's Kitchen.

programme.title: Filly Brown
programme.desc: In this moving, gritty drama, a young hip-hop artist strives for success in the hope of elevating her family out of poverty, but when opportunity finally comes knocking, she realizes that a record contract might rob her of her very identity.

programme.title: Rapture-Palooza
programme.desc: In this hilariously irreverent comedy, Seattle suburbanites Ben and Lindsey learn that life after the Rapture is no picnic when the Beast himself moves into their neighborhood and aims to make lovely Lindsey his infernal bride.

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: In this mesmerizing horror fantasy, an apartment manager finds a sea nymph called a \"narf\" in the complex's swimming pool, and tries to return her to her natural habitat. However, otherworldly monsters are out to stop him.

programme.title: American Son
programme.desc: A marine, fresh out of boot camp, returns home for Thanksgiving before being sent to Iraq. He faces family strife, while dealing with a budding relationship and animosity from jealous friends.

programme.title: Before the Devil Knows You're Dead
programme.desc: Director Sidney Lumet, at age 83, proves that he still has what it takes to enthrall an audience. This riveting crime thriller follows financially strapped brothers (Philip Seymour Hoffman, Ethan Hawke) whose foolproof jewelry-store heist goes awry in tragic ways that leave two people dead. Albert Finney is superb as the siblings' father, and owner of the targeted shop. The film's title comes from an Irish toast: \"May you be in heaven half an hour before the devil knows you're dead.\".

programme.title: Anna
programme.desc: A strikingly beautiful woman unleashes her strength and skills in order to become one of the best government assassins in the world. Later, she is recruited by the CIA to kill KGB's head in exchanged for immediate retirement and lifetime protection.

programme.title: The Last of the Finest
programme.desc: Lone wolf undercover cops investigate a drug trafficking ring, after they attempt a major bust that fails. They uncover a web of conspiracy that involves their fellow cops, as well as government officials.

programme.title: Beginners
programme.desc: In this uplifting comedy-drama, Oliver (Ewan McGregor) deals with his 75-year-old father Hal's announcement that he's gay and has been diagnosed with terminal cancer. He learns about life and love from Hal before his dad passes away, and soon falls for a French actress.

programme.title: Tully
programme.desc: At the encouragement of her brother, Marlo, an overwhelmed mother of three, and her husband Drew hire a young night nurse named Tully to care for their newborn. Tully becomes a confidant for Marlo, who is grappling with her identity as a wife and mother.

programme.title: Doctor Sleep
programme.desc: In this sequel to \"The Shining,\" an adult Dan Torrance befriends a young girl with similar psychic powers as himself. They join forces against The True Knot: An evil cult that exploits children with supernatural powers in their quest for immortality.

programme.title: Broken City
programme.desc: In this nail-biting thriller, the mayor of NYC hires a disgraced former cop, now working as a private eye, to expose his wife's infidelities. As he does so, the PI begins to unravel a mystery that could bring about the end of more than just a marriage.

programme.title: Proof of Life
programme.desc: After her husband is kidnapped by terrorists in South America, a woman begins to fall for the mercenary hired to help rescue him in this sizzling romantic thriller.

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Rob Brown gives a stellar performance in this winning fact-based sports biopic. He plays Syracuse University running back Ernie Davis, the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy as the outstanding college-football player in the nation in 1961. Dennis Quaid costars as Syracuse coach Ben Schwartzwalder. Directed by Gary Fleder. The screenplay is by Charles Leavitt, who based it on the book \"Ernie Davis: The Elmira Express,\" written by Syracuse alumnus Robert C. Gallagher.

programme.title: Seven Psychopaths
programme.desc: In this outrageous, oddball comedy from the writer-director of \"In Bruges,\" a screenwriter and his friends must contend with Los Angeles' most-insane criminals after they kidnap a gangster's precious shih tzu.

programme.title: The Original Kings of Comedy
programme.desc: Comedians Steve Harvey, D.L. Hughley, Cedric the Entertainer and Bernie Mac bring down the house in this outrageous concert film. Director Spike Lee captures the geniuses behind the \"Kings of Comedy\" tour as they perform in Charlotte, N.C. in February 2000.

programme.title: Croupier
programme.desc: Mike Hodges, director of 1971's \"Get Carter\" with Michael Caine, gambled and won with this acclaimed caper film. Clive Owen stars as Jack Manfred, a struggling author and London casino worker. Jack rolls the dice with a seductress (Alex Kingston), whose associates plan to rip off his employers. Gina McKee, Kate Hardie, Nicholas Ball.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl (?)
programme.desc: Robert Rodriguez follows up his successful \"Spy Kids\" films with another delightful, family-friendly adventure. Bullied and mocked, 10-year-old Max escapes from his dreary life by conjuring up two imaginary superhero friends---Sharkboy and Lavagirl. When his fantasy characters actually come alive, Max joins them on a wild adventure to defeat an über-villain named Mr. Electric.

programme.title: Separated
programme.desc: A wind-up toy robot goes on an epic journey to save his better half.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: A fanatical U.S. general launches a nuclear attack on Russia during the Cold War, but the President and his advisors are shocked to learn that the Russians have technology that will destroy the world in the event of an attack on them.

programme.title: Tommy Boy
programme.desc: A boisterous bumbler vows to save his late father's auto-parts business with the aid of a prissy company man.

programme.title: Dick
programme.desc: Michelle Williams and Kirsten Dunst are a blast in this sly satire as ditzy 1970s high schoolers hired as dog-walkers by President Nixon (Dan Hedaya). When Watergate erupts, the girls' behind-the-scenes access leads them to uncover surprising secrets. Teri Garr, Dave Foley, Jim Breuer, Will Ferrell.

programme.title: The Secret of My Success
programme.desc: A Kansas farm boy goes to New York City and succeeds in business by impersonating an executive. Once his oversexed aunt enters the mix, the ambitious ladder-climber finds himself juggling two identities, two jobs and two women.

programme.title: The Great Outdoors
programme.desc: An obnoxious loudmouth ruins his mild-mannered brother-in-law's summer vacation by barging in on his remote mountain cabin getaway.

programme.title: Reality Bites
programme.desc: A Gen X-er documents the lives of herself and her contemporaries as they face life after college.

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: George Clooney wears two hats, or in the case of this winning gridiron romp, one hat and one helmet, as both director and star. He plays Dodge Connolly, a 1920s pro-footballer who tries to save his floundering squad by signing a college star (John Krasinski) to help get the team on track and, more important, turn a profit. Renee Zellweger costars as a reporter who becomes the object of affection for both. Randy Newman, who composed the film score, has a cameo as a speakeasy piano player.

programme.title: Tommy Boy
programme.desc: A boisterous bumbler vows to save his late father's auto-parts business with the aid of a prissy company man.

programme.title: Dick
programme.desc: Michelle Williams and Kirsten Dunst are a blast in this sly satire as ditzy 1970s high schoolers hired as dog-walkers by President Nixon (Dan Hedaya). When Watergate erupts, the girls' behind-the-scenes access leads them to uncover surprising secrets. Teri Garr, Dave Foley, Jim Breuer, Will Ferrell.

programme.title: The Queens of Comedy (?)
programme.desc: Comedians Miss Laura Hayes, Adele Givens, Sommore and Mo'Nique bring down the house with a quartet of saucy stand-up routines. Among the highlights: Sommore says she would like to see men come with a side-effects warning label, and \"big, ol' healthy girl\" Mo'Nique tells why skinny women are evil: \"They're always hungry.\".

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: The comic and star of film and television fires on all cylinders in this stand-up performance at Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C. Playfully profane innuendo and graphic gestures abound as Lawrence riffs on sex, love, race, drugs and family life, and even reflects on his legal and health troubles.

programme.title: Halloween: Resurrection
programme.desc: In the chilling eighth installment of the series, a group of frightened teens tries to live through the night in killer Michael Myers' childhood home as part of an Internet contest set up by an entrepreneur (Busta Rhymes). Little do they know that someone is in the house waiting for them. Jamie Lee Curtis, Ryan Merriman, Bianca Kajlich, Thomas Ian Nicholas.

programme.title: The Iron Lady
programme.desc: Meryl Streep stars in this gripping biopic of influential prime minister Margaret Thatcher, the woman who led the United Kingdom through the 1980s. Directed by Phyllida Lloyd.

programme.title: Why Stop Now
programme.desc: A piano prodigy prepares for an interview at Juilliard, while his mother attempts to buy cocaine in order to force her insurance to pay for her rehab in this endearingly quirky comedy.

programme.title: Hit!
programme.desc: Effective action yarn with Billy Dee Williams leading a vigilante group after drug pushers. Mike: Richard Pryor. Strong: Paul Hampton. Sherry: Gwen Welles. Schiller: Warren Kemmerling. Ida: Janet Brandt. Herman: Sid Melton. Carlin: David Hall. Crosby: Todd Martin. Director: Normann Burton. Mme. Frelou: Jenny Astruc. Romain: Yves Barsacq. Directed by Sidney J. Furie.

programme.title: The Game of Their Lives
programme.desc: From the director and writer of \"Hoosiers\" comes this inspirational true story of how a ragtag squad of American soccer players upset the elite British team in a 1950 World Cup match. Gerard Butler, Wes Bentley, Jay Rodan, Gavin Rossdale, Costas Mandylor. Directed by David Anspaugh.

programme.title: The Cold Light of Day
programme.desc: A hotshot stockbroker must save his family after they are kidnapped during a vacation in Spain. In order to do so, he will need to learn dark secrets from his father's past and uncover a government conspiracy.

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Best Picture winner about an FBI trainee (Best Actress Jodie Foster), who has a knack for analyzing serial killers, and enlists the aid of an imprisoned, cannibalistic sociopath (Best Actor Anthony Hopkins) in tracking a sadistic murderer. An Oscar went to director Jonathan Demme and also Ted Tally won for Best Adapted Screenplay for his script based on the Thomas Harris novel.

programme.title: Tammy and the Teenage T-Rex
programme.desc: A high-schooler's brain is transplanted into a mechanical dinosaur. Terry Kiser, Paul Walker, Denise Richards.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: A shy teenager, dominated by a religiously fanatic mother, suffers at the hands of high-school bullies, whose mean pranks rile the teen into discovering she has telekinetic powers, which she uses to take ultimate revenge at the prom.

programme.title: Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers
programme.desc: Murderer Michael Myers returns to his hometown of Haddonfield to kill his niece's child. A young man obsessed with Myers teams with the killer's former psychiatrist to stop him once and for all.

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Best Picture winner about an FBI trainee (Best Actress Jodie Foster), who has a knack for analyzing serial killers, and enlists the aid of an imprisoned, cannibalistic sociopath (Best Actor Anthony Hopkins) in tracking a sadistic murderer. An Oscar went to director Jonathan Demme and also Ted Tally won for Best Adapted Screenplay for his script based on the Thomas Harris novel.

programme.title: Hannibal
programme.desc: Cunning Hannibal Lecter resurfaces after a decade in hiding to toy with FBI agent Clarice Starling in this handsomely-mounted sequel. As Starling's career flounders, Lecter attempts to elude a greedy Italian police detective. Meanwhile, a maimed former victim of Lecter's plots revenge.

programme.title: The Last House on the Left
programme.desc: Chilling remake of the 1972 cult classic chronicles the gripping tale of homicidal maniacs who seek refuge at an out-of-the-way house that happens to be the home of their victim's parents, who learn of the killers' crime and seek revenge.

programme.title: Bopha!
programme.desc: Morgan Freeman directed this gritty saga, with Danny Glover as a principled South African policeman who begins to question apartheid. Alfre Woodard. De Villiers: Malcolm McDowell. Zweli: Maynard Eziashi. Van Tonder: Marius Weyers. Rampa: Malick Bowens. Solomon: Michael Chinyamurindi. Machikano: Christopher John Hall.

programme.title: CB4
programme.desc: A trio of failed musicians pose as ex-convicts turned hip-hop artists. As they rise to fame, turmoil brews within and a real ex-con seeks them out.

programme.title: The Cold Light of Day
programme.desc: A hotshot stockbroker must save his family after they are kidnapped during a vacation in Spain. In order to do so, he will need to learn dark secrets from his father's past and uncover a government conspiracy.

programme.title: Bulletproof Monk
programme.desc: An ageless monk guards a sacred scroll that can grant its readers the power to rule the world. With the help of a cocky pickpocket, the monk battles a Nazi who's trying to seize control of the artifact.

programme.title: Salvation Boulevard
programme.desc: A Christian named Carl (Greg Kinnear) falls under the spell of magnetic mega-church preacher Dan Day, but he soon witnesses Dan committing a shocking crime against an atheist author. Meanwhile, Carl is torn between his old life as a Grateful Dead fan and his new life as a man of God.

programme.title: The Hours
programme.desc: Powerhouse performances and a literate, emotionally rich script mark this Best Picture nominee. It's an Oscar-nominated adaptation of Michael Cunningham's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about three troubled women who are deeply dissatisfied with their lives: Virginia Woolf (Best Actress Nicole Kidman), a '50s housewife (Julianne Moore) and a modern-day book editor (Meryl Streep). Ed Harris, Miranda Richardson.

programme.title: Rudy
programme.desc: A diminutive underdog is obsessed with joining Notre Dame's football team. Based on actual events.

programme.title: Hotel Rwanda
programme.desc: Don Cheadle's Oscar-nominated turn drives this searing drama set during the Hutu-Tutsi civil war in Rwanda. Cheadle plays hotel manager Paul Rusesabagina, who tries to save the lives of more than a thousand Tutsi refugees by hiding them in his hotel. Terry George directed and co-wrote. The strong cast also includes Nick Nolte, Joaquin Phoenix and Best Supporting Actress nominee Sophie Okonedo.

programme.title: Winter Solstice
programme.desc: Anthony LaPaglia is superb as a grieving widower who struggles to deal with his youngest son's self-destructive behavior and his oldest son's decision to leave home. Josh Sternfeld wrote and directed this poignant family drama. Aaron Stanford, Mark Webber, Allison Janney.

programme.title: Sinister
programme.desc: A true-crime novelist moves into a house that was once the site of a multiple murder, and he soon encounters a deadly supernatural entity in this exciting horror tale.

programme.title: The Hours
programme.desc: Powerhouse performances and a literate, emotionally rich script mark this Best Picture nominee. It's an Oscar-nominated adaptation of Michael Cunningham's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about three troubled women who are deeply dissatisfied with their lives: Virginia Woolf (Best Actress Nicole Kidman), a '50s housewife (Julianne Moore) and a modern-day book editor (Meryl Streep). Ed Harris, Miranda Richardson.

programme.title: Margot at the Wedding
programme.desc: A cynical writer travels home to reconcile with her estranged, free-spirited sister, who is about to get married. Nicole Kidman and Jennifer Jason Leigh give superb performances in this incisive dramedy of family dysfunction. Written and directed by Noah Baumbach.

programme.title: Q: Into the Storm
programme.desc: Series finale. With the world in lockdown from COVID-19, Q's wild theories draw in new followers and get amplified by major political figures, all of which culminate in the siege at the U.S. Capitol. Reflecting on years of his collected evidence, Cullen draws conclusions on who is behind QAnon and its future impact.

programme.title: One Day
programme.desc: In this touching romantic drama, a working-class woman (Anne Hathaway) and a wealthy playboy (Jim Sturgess) reunite every July 15 for 20 years. Over the course of two decades, they experience the highs and lows of life and consider becoming a couple. Directed by Lone Scherfig.

programme.title: The Return
programme.desc: This film examines the many challenges of reintegration faced by convicts and their families after a new law mandates the prisoners' early release.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver 216

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.sub-title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel Xxxx21 - #287
programme.desc: An award-winning monthly sports journalism series with investigative pieces and in-depth profiles from across the sports spectrum.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: Martial arts master Jet Li stars in this stylized action adventure from acclaimed director Zhang Yimou. The \"Rashomon\"-style epic centers on a swordsman who claims to have saved a ruthless Chinese emperor from a trio of assassins.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In this well-acted fantasy about changing history, James Caviezel plays a grieving cop who hears the voice of his dead father (Dennis Quaid) while experimenting with a ham-radio set. Together, they try to stop the events that led to the man's death. Andre Braugher.

programme.title: Agents of Chaos
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. A report on Russian attempts to interfere in the 2016 U.S. election includes a look at troll farms that used social media to sow division among the electorate and interviews with key figures in the investigations of the Trump campaign.

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: A New York adman deals with the pain of losing a child by writing letters to Time, Death and Love. He is soon visited by representations of the three concepts, who try to help him return to some semblance of a normal life in this uplifting drama.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: An army of alien spaceships attack Earth and threaten to destroy the human race, but a handful of survivors band together to stop the invasion.

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver 216

programme.title: The Book of Eli
programme.desc: Eli roams a postapocalyptic world, protecting a sacred tome that offers guidance on how to rebuild humanity in this stylish, futuristic thriller. The evil Carnegie goes to great lengths to acquire the powerful book, but Carnegie's adopted daughter, who wants to escape her dad's clutches, helps Eli.

programme.title: Q: Into the Storm
programme.desc: As the rivalry between Fred and the Watkins intensifies, 8chan is relaunched as \"8kun,\" where Q re-emerges after months being offline. Meanwhile, ex-military and political operatives aim to tap the power of Q. Back in Manila, Jim slaps Fred with a lawsuit, forcing him to plan a great escape.
