programme.title: Waitress
programme.desc: Adrienne Shelly wrote, directed and costars in this charming and bittersweet tale of a pregnant small-town Southern waitress (Keri Russell) hoping to win a pie-baking contest and leave her boorish husband. Nathan Fillion, Cheryl Hines, Andy Griffith, Jeremy Sisto.

programme.desc: A successful career criminal considers getting out of the business after one last score with his crew, while an obsessive cop desperately tries to put him behind bars. The memorable \"cafe scene\" marks the first time Al Pacino and Robert De Niro have appeared on-screen together.

programme.desc: In 1960s Los Angeles, silver screen actor Rick Dalton and his stunt double turned best friend, Cliff Booth, struggle to keep pace with the swiftly evolving entertainment industry. They both work to continue their notoriety while facing the demise of Hollywood's Golden Age.

programme.desc: Conclusion. The Hatfields are forced deeper into the mountains; Johnse Hatfield eyes another McCoy woman; and the fighting between the two families peaks in a New Year's Day battle.

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: A fictionalized portrait of 13th-century Scottish rebel William Wallace, who led insurgents against oppressive English rule.

programme.title: L.A. Confidential
programme.desc: The seedy side of 1950s L.A. sets the stage for this stylish crime thriller starring Kevin Spacey, Russell Crowe and Guy Pearce. In a tale of deceit and corruption, three cops work together to solve a multiple murder that took out one of their own. Kim Basinger, James Cromwell. Based on James Ellroy's novel.

programme.title: Ultraviolet
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich stars in this action-packed, visually dazzling sci-fi thriller about a sexy mutant trying to protect a young boy from an evil dictator in the late 21st century. Cameron Bright, Nick Chinlund, William Fichtner. Directed by Kurt Wimmer.

programme.title: Critters 3
programme.desc: The creatures take over an apartment building. Aimee Brooks, John Calvin, Katherine Cortez, Leonardo DiCaprio, Geoffrey Blake, Don Opper, Diana Bellamy. Directed by Kristine Peterson.

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: The winner of 11 Academy Awards, this epic drama centers on the story of star-crossed lovers aboard the doomed luxury liner as it sails toward its tragic destiny in the icy waters of the North Atlantic.

programme.title: Greed
programme.desc: Richard McCreadie is a billionaire who made his fortune by buying clothing stores and running them into the ground. For his 60th birthday, he plans a five-day party at Mykonos, even adapting a 'Gladiator' theme for it. However, with only days before the huge event, he discovers that the place is far from ready — the view is spoiled by Syrian refugees camping on the beach, bad press has caused celebrities to decline his invitation, and his man-made coliseum is still being constructed.

programme.title: The Hollars
programme.desc: In this charming comedy-drama, a frustrated cartoonist awaiting the birth of his first child is forced to reconnect with his dysfunctional family when his mother is diagnosed with a brain tumor.

programme.title: For Love of the Game
programme.desc: Kevin Costner slides into his third baseball-themed film, a well-crafted sentimental voyage which nicely blends romantic drama with intense on-field action. Costner plays aging Detroit Tigers hurler Billy Chapel, who takes the mound for the final game of the season---and maybe his career. As he strives to pitch a perfect game, Chapel reminisces about a whirlwind romance. Kelly Preston.

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious weatherman finds himself reliving the same 24-hour period over and over.

programme.title: After the Wedding
programme.desc: Isabel has dedicated her life to working with the children in an orphanage in Calcutta. Theresa is the multimillionaire head of a media company who lives with her handsome artist husband and their two adorable twin boys in New York. When word comes to Isabel of a mysterious and generous grant for the financially struggling orphanage, she must travel to New York to meet the benefactor Theresa in person.

programme.title: Far and Away
programme.desc: An impoverished 19th-century Irish tenant farmer has recently lost his home and his father and runs off to America with his landlord's daughter. They arrive in America with barely more than the clothes on their backs and struggle for the American dream.

programme.title: Monsters University
programme.desc: Mike and Sulley attend Monsters University and develop a heated rivalry that puts their education in danger in this frightfully fun prequel set before they were both star employees at Monsters, Inc.

programme.title: Annie
programme.desc: John Huston's adaptation of the Broadway musical about the plucky comic-strip orphan who dreams of finding a loving family while toiling in an institution run by a mean woman.

Theresa is the multimillionaire head of a media company who lives with her handsome artist husband and their two adorable twin boys in New York. When word comes to Isabel of a mysterious and generous grant for the financially struggling orphanage, she must travel to New York to meet the benefactor Theresa in person.

programme.title: Amelia
programme.desc: This sweeping biopic spans the life of aviator extraordinaire Amelia Earhart (Hilary Swank), whose famous voyage across the Atlantic was tragically overshadowed by her mysterious disappearance five years later. Richard Gere, Ewan McGregor.

programme.title: Planes
programme.desc: In this high-flying spin-off of the Pixar hit \"Cars,\" a humble crop duster dreams of becoming a great air racer, and competes against the fastest plane around with the help of a veteran aviator.

programme.title: Planes: Fire & Rescue
programme.desc: In this charming animated adventure, Dusty fights forest fires at the Piston Peak Air Attack Base. With the guidance of some new friends, including a fire-and-rescue helicopter named Blade Ranger, he soars through the clouds and saves the day.

programme.title: Big Hero 6
programme.desc: In this ridiculously fun animated adventure, a young tech whiz named Hiro must save his city from a nefarious villain with the help of his inflatable robot Baymax, as well as his friends Go Go Tomago, Wasabi, Honey Lemon and Fred.

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: In this delightful animated film, emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life in the Midwest and forced to move to San Francisco. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings.

programme.title: Monsters University
programme.desc: Mike and Sulley attend Monsters University and develop a heated rivalry that puts their education in danger in this frightfully fun prequel set before they were both star employees at Monsters, Inc.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: This uproarious animated comedy follows the high jinks that ensue when an ordinary human unwittingly checks in at the Hotel Transylvania during the same time Dracula is busy hosting a monsters-only birthday party for his daughter.

programme.title: Roxanne
programme.desc: A loquacious fireman with an abnormally large nose helps a dimwitted co-worker win the heart of the woman he himself pines for in this modern-day retelling of Cyrano.

programme.title: Dark Tide (?)
programme.desc: Terror runs deep when a renowned shark expert attempts to recover from a tragic diving mishap by taking a wealthy businessman swimming with the deep sea-predators, only to get stranded in a dangerous feeding ground known as \"Shark Alley.\".

programme.title: Are We Done Yet?
programme.desc: A family exchanges a cramped New York City apartment for a rural dream house that turns out to be the fixer-upper from hell. Ice Cube and Nia Long return in this hilarious sequel to \"Are We There Yet?\" John C. McGinley, Aleisha Allen, Philip Daniel Bolden. Directed by Steve Carr.

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: In this delightful animated film, emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life in the Midwest and forced to move to San Francisco. programme.title: Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle
programme.desc: Two stoners with the munchies take a road trip through New Jersey in search of a hamburger joint in this hilarious and irreverent comedy. John Cho and Kal Penn star as the dazed and confused roommates; Jamie Kennedy and Neil Patrick Harris have cameos. Directed by Danny Leiner (\"Dude, Where's My Car?\").

programme.title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
programme.desc: Mr. Fantastic, the Invisible Woman, the Human Torch and the Thing return in this exciting sequel to the 2005 sci-fi hit. This time, the four superheroes encounter a mysterious alien who heralds the arrival of the planet-devouring Galactus.

programme.title: Juno
programme.desc: Best Actress nominee Ellen Page stars as a sassy teen who becomes pregnant after her first sexual encounter and decides to give up her baby to a well-off couple. A sharp and witty slice-of-life comedy that was up for Best Picture and Best Director (Jason Reitman). First-time screenwriter Diablo Cody won the Oscar for Best Original Screenplay. Michael Cera, J.K. Simmons.

programme.title: Fools Rush In
programme.desc: Three months after their short-lived fling in Las Vegas, buttoned-down businessman Alex (Matthew Perry) learns that free-spirited Isabel (Salma Hayek), a Mexican-American, is pregnant. They decide to follow their hearts and get married, but they must deal with the resulting culture clash between their families. Jon Tenney, Jill Clayburgh.

programme.title: Tootsie
programme.desc: Best Actor nominee Dustin Hoffman portrays a struggling actor who disguises himself as a woman to land a job on a soap and becomes a hit, fooling his agent, his costar... and maybe himself.

programme.title: Driven
programme.desc: This biographical thriller is loosely inspired by the life of American automobile engineer and executive John DeLorean. It follows his quest to manufacture an unprecedentedly futuristic sports car and his friendship with FBI informant James Hoffman.

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle
programme.desc: Two stoners with the munchies take a road trip through New Jersey in search of a hamburger joint in this hilarious and irreverent comedy. John Cho and Kal Penn star as the dazed and confused roommates; Jamie Kennedy and Neil Patrick Harris have cameos. Directed by Danny Leiner (\"Dude, Where's My Car?\").

programme.title: District 9
programme.desc: Science fiction gets a bold new face in this film about a South African internment camp that houses extraterrestrial refugees under the authority of a private firm. Meanwhile, a field operative is exposed to alien biotechnology.

programme.title: Official Secrets
programme.desc: In the lead-up to the Iraq War, British intelligence specialist Katharine Gun makes the difficult decision to defy her government and release a confidential memo exposing an illegal NSA operation to the press.

programme.title: Paranoia
programme.desc: In this relentless psychological thriller, blue-collar worker Adam Cassidy becomes a corporate spy for a ruthless CEO who wants him to infiltrate the competition. In time, Adam realizes that he's being used as a pawn in a much-larger game.

programme.title: Before the Fire
programme.desc: A global pandemic forces TV star Ava Boone to escape from Los Angeles to her rural hometown.

programme.title: Madeline's Madeline
programme.desc: Race, class, and artistry intersect in the world of New York experimental theatre. A gifted but troubled biracial teenager is torn between her protective mother and the theater director who pushes her to use her personal struggles in her art.

programme.title: XXX
programme.desc: While in jail, an extreme-sports enthusiast is blackmailed by a government agency to attempt to infiltrate a Russian crime ring that has access to biochemical weapons. An action-packed adrenaline rush.

programme.title: Mississippi Grind
programme.desc: Two lifelong gamblers hit the road for a high-stakes poker tournament in New Orleans, but revelations about their addictions threaten to derail their trip in this dramatic character study.

programme.title: The Fits
programme.desc: An isolated 11-year-old girl joins a dance drill team at her local rec center, but her newfound friends and teammates begin to suffer from mysterious fainting episodes in this alluring psychological drama.

programme.title: Hampstead
programme.desc: An American widow living in an expensive apartment in Hampstead Heath, London joins forces with a brusque Irish man living off the land after his cabin is threatened with demolition by real estate agents in this unconventional love story based on true events.

programme.title: America's Sweethearts
programme.desc: In this all-star, screwball comedy, an estranged Hollywood couple (Catherine Zeta-Jones, John Cusack) tries to create the illusion that they're happy at a press junket for their upcoming movie. Julia Roberts also stars as the actress's sister, who secretly loves brother-in-law Cusack. Billy Crystal, Christopher Walken, Hank Azaria, Stanley Tucci.

programme.title: Ode to Joy
programme.desc: Martin Freeman has fallen in love and can't get up. A man's attempts to avoid happiness that spurs narcolepsy are put to the ultimate test when he falls in love.

programme.title: Ophelia
programme.desc: Ophelia, a rebellious young woman, is taken in by the Queen of Denmark, Gertrude, to be one of her ladies-in-waiting. Through the years, she becomes one of the Queen's most favored, and when Hamlet, the Queen's son, comes back home from studying, they eventually fall in love. As a power struggle arises in the castle, Ophelia needs to make a hard decision -- her love or her life.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
programme.desc: The sweeping conclusion to the \"Twilight\" series follows Bella, Edward and Jacob as they band together to fight a group of ancient vampires who are threatening to destroy Bella and Edward's family.

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: The popular stage musical based on the songs of pop sensation ABBA comes to the screen in all its sing-along glory. A bride-to-be (Amanda Seyfried) in Greece attempts to solve the mystery of her paternity by reading the diary of her mother (Meryl Streep). Pierce Brosnan, Stellan Skarsgard and Colin Firth are the likeliest suspects. Christine Baranaski, Julie Walters, Dominic Cooper.

programme.title: Strictly Ballroom
programme.desc: Dynamic choreography enhances this story of a rebellious dancer (Paul Mercurio), his novice partner (Tara Morice) and a prestigious competition. Fife: Bill Hunter. Hastings: Barry Otto. Shirley: Pat Thompson. Liz: Gia Carides. Kendall: Peter Whitford. Railings: John Hannan. Directed and co-written by Baz Luhrmann.

programme.title: The Go-Go's
programme.desc: As the first multi-platinum-selling, all-female band to play their own instruments, write their own songs and soar to number one on the album charts, the Go-Go's are the most successful female rock band of all time. Underpinned by candid testimonies from The Go-Go's past and present, this documentary chronicles the meteoric rise to fame of a band born of the L.A. punk scene that not only captured but created a zeitgeist.

programme.title: Mo' Better Blues
programme.desc: This ode to jazz focuses on Bleek Gilliam, a self-absorbed, contemporary trumpet player whose blind devotion to his own talent causes rifts in his professional and personal lives.

programme.title: Under the Skin
programme.desc: An alien assumes the form of an alluring female and prowls the streets of Scotland, leading lonely and unsuspecting men to their doom in this intriguing, visually arresting sci-fi thriller.

programme.title: Ode to Joy
programme.desc: Martin Freeman has fallen in love and can't get up. A man's attempts to avoid happiness that spurs narcolepsy are put to the ultimate test when he falls in love.

programme.title: Beneath a Sea of Lights
programme.desc: A billboard repairman in Dubai tries to experience the products on his billboards as a con artist takes him under his wing.

programme.title: XXX: State of the Union
programme.desc: Thrilling shoot-'em-up sequel about a special agent who's recruited to stop a plot to kill the president.

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: In this taut thriller, forensics expert Alex Cross investigates the disappearance of a senator's daughter, a student at a prestigious private academy.

programme.title: Rambo III
programme.desc: A former war veteran storms Afghanistan to rescue his old CO from the Soviets.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: The third installment of the electrifying \"Twilight\" saga finds Bella (Kristen Stewart) forced to choose between Edward (Robert Pattinson), a vampire and the love of her life, or Jacob Black (Taylor Lautner), a werewolf and her best friend. The result of her decision may reignite the ancient feud between vampires and werewolves, while a scorned vampire bent on revenge appears responsible for a string of brutal murders.

programme.title: Amy
programme.desc: An intimate look at the life of talented but troubled British singer-songwriter Amy Winehouse, who died in 2011. The film includes rare interviews with the subject and previously unreleased songs.

programme.title: Home Again
programme.desc: A recently separated woman moves to L.A. with her two daughters, where she rents out her guesthouse to three much-younger men—one of whom she soon begins dating. However, her estranged husband soon reenters the picture in this winning romantic comedy.

programme.title: Room
programme.desc: In this heartwrenching drama, a woman and her young son are held captive for years in a tiny shed. They finally manage to escape from their abductor, but the pair struggle to adjust to the outside world after their traumatic confinement.

programme.title: Swallow
programme.desc: When a newly pregnant young woman develops a compulsion to consume dangerous household objects, her new inexplicable impulse mars her seemingly picture-perfect married life and places a great strain on her relationship with her husband and mother-in-law.

programme.title: All I See Is You
programme.desc: A blind woman living in Bangkok undergoes an experimental procedure to restore her sight. However, her husband soon grows jealous of her newfound independence in this powerful drama, as she now sees more clearly the flaws in their relationship.

programme.title: Ambition
programme.desc: A young, aspiring musician is confident she can win it all in an upcoming competition, but during the preparation period, she winds up in a dangerous trap from which there may be no way out.

programme.title: Volition
programme.desc: James has lived his entire life with an unusual ability of foresight and, as he ages, he struggles to cope with his powers of clairvoyance. Yet when he experiences an unsettling insight into his own murder, he strives to change the future in his present.

programme.title: Amy
programme.desc: An intimate look at the life of talented but troubled British singer-songwriter Amy Winehouse, who died in 2011. The film includes rare interviews with the subject and previously unreleased songs.

programme.title: Without a Paddle
programme.desc: Three pals answer the call of the wild in this raucous, fish-out-of-water comedy.

programme.title: The Ladies Man
programme.desc: Tim Meadows gets down and dirty as his Saturday Night Live character Leon Phelps in this raunchy comedy. When the randy late-night disc jockey loses his job, his producer (Karyn Parsons) helps him find work. Leon also must contend with jealous husbands seeking revenge for his romantic attentions to their wives. Billy Dee Williams, Will Ferrell, John Witherspoon.

programme.title: The Aspern Papers
programme.desc: A young writer named Morton Vint becomes obsessed with the passionate romantic life of poet Jeffrey Aspern and the letters he wrote to his mistress decades ago. Now Morton must do all that he can to get a hold of these letters from the aging mistress and her niece.

programme.title: Blackout
programme.desc: Two strangers are about to witness the death of the Sun. This short film takes place in the approximate eight minutes it takes for light to reach Earth from the Sun, as two strangers, Sampson and Darryl, discuss what they wish they could have done differently had they not taken sunlight for granted.

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Stephenie Meyer's romantic and suspenseful best seller that started the phenomenon comes to life in this action-packed chronicle of the modern-day love story between a teenage girl and a vampire. Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson star. Billy Burke, Peter Facinelli, Elizabeth Reaser. Directed by Catherine Hardwicke.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: This thrilling second installment of the popular \"Twilight\" saga finds Bella Swan in pieces after her vampire boyfriend leaves town. She soon reconnects with a childhood friend and realizes he's hiding a dark secret that may hold the key to her survival.

programme.title: Semper Fi
programme.desc: A police officer serves double time with the Marine Corps Reserves. However, his loyalty to his country, his uniform, and his own ethical code is called into question when his incarcerated brother asks for help from behind bars. He must then make a choice between duty to one's service and duty to one's family.

programme.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
programme.desc: This epic won an Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film and became the highest-grossing foreign movie of all time when it was released. Hong Kong superstar Chow Yun-Fat plays a warrior in ancient China who is trying to retrieve a stolen magical sword. Director Ang Lee's characters soar through the air as he combines gravity-defying action scenes with a sweet love story. Michelle Yeoh.

programme.title: Resistance
programme.desc: Amidst the Second World War, aspiring Jewish actor Marcel Mangel recruits a group of young Jewish Boy Scouts to work on behalf of the French Resistance to protect thousands of orphaned children as the brutal Nazi regime further encroaches upon their communities.

programme.title: Red Joan
programme.desc: A suburban widow conceals a double-life as a Soviet spy in this true-life tale of passion, courage, and betrayal.
